title: Pattern Matching vs. Polymorphism
excerpt: Subtype polymorphism is great for adding more entity types. Pattern matching is a better choice for adding more functionality. In this article, we implement a program based on a set of requirements. First, using subtype polymorphism, then using pattern matching.

title: Component Testing in Java
excerpt: The ability to test a micro service in isolation is an integral part of a fast and independent release cycle. In this live coding session, I shared how we set up isolated test cases for a real world microservice.

title: fboeller.github.io
excerpt: My personal resume that you are currently viewing.

title: Functional Idioms with Java
excerpt: With requirements on throughput and scalability, object-oriented programs become increasingly difficult to maintain. Functional programming idioms make it into the object-oriented world aiming to address this problem.

title: Using Java 8 to convert a list into a string
excerpt: Is there a way to build a string that concatenates the output of calls to the toString() method from the instances of a list in a single line?

title: Avoid Runtime Errors with Optionals
excerpt: Null is bad for representing the absence of a value, use Optionals instead. Use Optional.flatMap to chain multiple operations that might not return a value.
